section.title: Extract Ruby Related Details from the Heap Dumps
section.p: The Leak Suspects report has been extended to contain Ruby relevant information if a suspect thread was executing JRuby code somewhere on its call-stack. If possible MAT will point out which ruby script was being executed, and also provide the Ruby call-stack (next to the Java call-stack) of the thread.

image.alt: Ruby details added to the Leaks report

section.p: Detailed ruby stack trace can also be extracted for JRuby threads using the context menu "Java Basics" -> "Thread Details" on a Thread object.

section.title: Set Operations on Compared Tables
section.p: When comparing tables from one and the same heap dump, it is now possible to perform different set operations on the comparison result.

image.alt: Context menu in the Compare Basket

section.title: Links to Objects in HTML Reports
section.p: If a Memory Analyzer report (e.g. the Leak Suspect report) is open in the tool itself and not in a browser, then it will be possible to list at least some of the objects "behind" a row in tables (e.g. in a Histogram). Up to now only links to single objects were rendered. Now also the first up to 10 objects can be listed:

image.alt: Open a list of objects directly from the HTML report

section.title: Accessibility Improvements
section.p: This release of MAT contains a series of accessibility improvements related to better support for keyboard navigation, screen reader (JAWS), and high contrast mode.
